news.title: Chris Mason: Why, in my judgement, Reeves was misleading on one specific point
news.summary: The Chancellor chose not to share some information on tax receipts in an unusual press conference, given before the Budget.

news.title: Heads of UK Special Forces suppressed evidence of war crimes, officer tells inquiry
news.summary: An officer tells the Independent Inquiry relating to Afghanistan UK Special Forces leadership was "very much suppressing" the allegations.

news.title: Four dead in Russian attack as diplomatic efforts to end war continue
news.summary: As US negotiating teams continue to hold talks with Moscow and Kyiv, Russia's attacks on Ukraine continue.

news.title: Tulip Siddiq MP given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
news.summary: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.

news.title: Weather warnings issued as month's worth of rain could fall in 24 hours
news.summary: Parts of the UK could see a month's worth of rainfall in just one day.

news.title: 'Sweeter than a marmalade sandwich' - Paddington musical declared a hit by critics
news.summary: The beloved bear stars in a new stage adaptation with songs written by McFly's Tom Fletcher.

news.title: I have high levels of forever chemicals in my blood - what can I do about it?
news.summary: The chemicals would "most likely" impact my health, but there are ways to bring levels down, I was told.

news.title: An angry confrontation and online abuse: Inside the asylum protests in a divided town
news.summary: A Disclosure documentary uncovers the figures behind the protests around asylum hotels which have divided communities.

news.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 500
news.summary: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured after a cyclone hit the region.

news.title: David Dimbleby: Can William's 'ordinary Joe' approach win back more support for the monarchy?
news.summary: Polls suggest public approval for the monarchy has declined, which raises the question of what King Charles and Prince William could do to win back more support for the institution.
